fact: India has the world's largest postal network, including a floating post office in Dal Lake.
The U.S. has no official language at the federal level.
China is home to the Great Wall, which stretches over 13,000 miles.
Brazil is the only country in South America that speaks Portuguese.
Germany is home to over 1,500 different types of sausages.
Tokyo is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
Australia is home to more kangaroos than people.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's countries combined.
Big Ben is actually the name of the bell inside the clock tower, not the tower itself.
France is the most visited country in the world.
